participant_1.background:
I enjoy exercising and try to work out as often as I can, but it can be hard to find the time, especially with my night shift schedule.
i have a set of identical twin brothers.
I have never been arrested, but I sometimes need to be alone to clear my head.
i enjoy reading and cooking.
I am a female in my early 20s.

participant_2.background:
I'm not a morning person, but I love reading mystery novels.
i am recently divorced.
i listen to podcasts.
i like to fly kites.
i daydream about cafes in paris.

content.text: Hi, how are you?
Hello! I'm good, thanks for asking.
What's your favorite thing to do?
I love to read, especially mystery novels.
Oh, what are some of your favorite authors?
I like Agatha Christie, and I've also been enjoying some of the newer authors like Paula Hawkins and Gillian Flynn.
I've read a few of those! What do you like about them?
I love the way they create suspense and keep you guessing.
Me too! I love it when I can't figure out who the killer is until the end.
Me too! I think that's what makes them so good.
I've been wanting to read more mysteries, do you have any recommendations?
Sure, I have a few. I recently read "The Woman in the Window" by AJ Finn and I really enjoyed it. It's about a woman who witnesses a murder from her apartment window, but no one believes her.
That sounds really interesting, I'll have to check it out.
I also really enjoyed "The Girl on the Train" by Paula Hawkins. It's about a woman who sees a man and a woman arguing on a train platform, and then the woman disappears.
Oh, I've heard of that one! I'll have to add it to my list.
Those are my two most recent favorites, but I've also enjoyed a lot of other mystery novels.
I'm definitely going to have to start reading more mysteries!
I think you'll really enjoy them.
Thanks for the recommendations!
You're welcome!
